Prerequisites: "C" OR BETTER IN ACG 2021 OR PERMISSION OF CHAIRPERSON.
Course Description:
CASH FLOW STATEMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS, PRODUCT COSTING SYSTEMS, COST-VOLUME-PROFIT ANALYSIS, PERFORMANCE EVALUATION, COST STANDARDS, BUDGETING, PRICING DECISIONS, CAPITAL EXPENDITURE DECISIONS, TAXES, AND MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING ANALYSIS.
THIS COURSE ALSO HELPS DEVELOP THE GENERAL EDUCATION OUTCOMES OF (1) CRITICAL/CREATIVE THINKING; (2) COMMUNICATION; (3) CULTURAL LITERACY; AND (4) INFORMATION AND TECHNICAL LITERACY.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1.ANALYZE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PREPARE STATEMENTS OF CASH FLOWS.  (1, 2, 4)
2.DISTINGUISH BETWEEN FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING APPLICATION AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING APPLICATION OF FINANCIAL DATA. (1, 2, 3)
3.EVALUATE BUSINESS DECISIONS USING A VARIETY OF MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES. (1, 2, 4)
4.INTEGRATE MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS BY PRODUCING A HOMEWORK PORTFOLIO. (1, 2, 4)
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
